item.title: Monopoly GO: When is the Next Sticker Boom Event?
item.description:
Stickers are an important collectible item in Monopoly GO . Players collect them by various methods and earn rewards by completing their Sticker Sets. Collecting stickers can prove to be a hassle for many players, since there are only limited ways to get your hands on them. Luckily, Monopoly GO allows players to cash out on big rewards, including stickers, with the help of in-game events.

A Sticker Boom is an in-game event in Monopoly GO that increases the sticker count for players when they open a sticker pack. However, like other in-game events, this is a time-sensitive event and appears for a very short duration. With this guide, Monopoly GO players can learn more about the Sticker Boom Event and when to expect next one.

Updated on August 31, 2025, by Usama Ali: With the brand-new Bon Appétit album now live in Monopoly GO, players are racing to collect stickers and start completing their food-inspired sticker sets. Since every new album launch brings a wave of excitement, many are already keeping an eye out for a Sticker Boom. These short but powerful flash events give a major boost to sticker drop rates, making them one of the best chances to secure rare finds and speed through album progress. We’ve updated this guide with information about the next Sticker Boom in Monopoly GO.

What Is a Sticker Boom Event in Monopoly GO?

During a Sticker Boom, players can temporarily collect more stickers than the usual amount when opening sticker packs. This makes it a great opportunity to complete sticker sets and unlock rewards. Like other flash events, a Sticker Boom is only active for a limited time, so players need to be ready to take advantage of it when it occurs.

Sticker Booms can be very helpful, especially at the mid and late stages of a sticker album. Since the ongoing album has been live for a few weeks, many players have already made significant progress in their collections. However, as they approach the final stages of completing their albums, it can become increasingly difficult to obtain the remaining stickers.

This is where Sticker Booms can be a game-changer. By increasing the number of stickers obtained from regular packs, Sticker Booms can help players close their albums faster and win the grand prize.

The table below showcases the number of stickers included in a pack, with and without the Sticker Boom event.

Sticker Pack

With Sticker Boom Event

Without Sticker Boom Event

Green (1-Star Stickers)

3

1

Orange (2-Star Stickers)

5

2

Pink (3-Star Stickers)

5

2

Blue (4-Star Stickers)

6

4

Purple (5-Star Stickers)

9

6

Since the Sticker Boom is active for a very short time (usually 10-20 minutes), players must aim to open their sticker packs while it is active.

When is the Next Sticker Boom Event in Monopoly GO?

At the moment, Scopely hasn’t announced the official date for the upcoming Sticker Boom in Monopoly GO . Unlike longer events, Sticker Booms don’t follow a fixed schedule and often appear as surprise windows lasting just a few minutes. This makes it even more important to be ready ahead of time.

Until the next Sticker Boom is confirmed, the smartest move is to collect more Sticker Stars and focus on filling your Vaults in the Sticker for Rewards menu. This way, when the Sticker Boom goes live, you can cash the vaults in to maximize your rewards.

Event dates and other details can change without notice, so make sure to keep an eye on Monopoly GO ’s official announcements for the latest updates.

Best Strategy For Sticker Boom Flash Event

In order to make the most out of the Sticker Boom event, players should try to collect as many stars as possible and try to have at least 700 stars before the Sticker Boom starts. This way, they can redeem these stars for a Gold Vault, which contains one Blue sticker pack, one five-star Purple sticker pack and a Swap Pack.

It's also a good idea to wait for the Sticker Boom event to start before opening your community chest, as it has a chance to reward you with a Purple Sticker Pack.

Monopoly Go!
1739
8.8 /10
Released
April 11, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: Monopoly GO: Today's Quick Wins Tasks (September 2025)
item.description:
Monopoly GO takes the classic board game to the next level with exciting events, tournaments, and daily challenges called Quick Wins. Quick Wins are simple, everyday tasks that reward you with new emojis, stickers, cash, and even dice rolls. Each day, you'll receive three tasks to complete within 24 hours.

When you complete a Quick Wins task, you earn points that contribute to a weekly progress bar. At the end of each week, you’ll win the grand prize if you’ve completed your Quick Wins every day. This is usually a five-star Purple Sticker Pack, but it can sometimes be a Wild Sticker too. Read on to learn about the Quick Wins you can complete today and get one step closer to unlocking the grand prize.

Updated August 31, 2025, by Usama Ali: Quick Wins are one of the simplest ways to stack up extra rewards every single day. You’ll be given three small challenges, like rolling dice a set number of times, building up your landmarks, or landing on specific spaces, that can be completed in just a few minutes of play. If you stick with it all week and clear all three challenges daily, you’ll fill your weekly progress meter to unlock a Purple Sticker Pack. These packs are especially valuable since they always contain at least one guaranteed five-star sticker, making them a must-have for anyone chasing progress in the new Bon Appetit album.

Since we update this guide regularly, you can bookmark it and check back later to get an upper hand before the mini-games start in Monopoly GO and grab limited-time, exclusive Star Wars-themed cosmetics before they disappear.

Weekly Quick Wins Tasks In Monopoly GO (September 1-September 7)

Quick Wins vary from simple actions like rolling the dice a certain number of times to more complex challenges participating in Shutdowns or Bank Heists a specific number of times. By consistently completing Quick Wins, players can earn valuable rewards and progress through the game more quickly.

Here are all the Quick Wins tasks you can complete in Monopoly GO this week:

1 September, Monday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Upgrade 1 Landmark

Dice

Bank heist 1 time

Cash

Roll Doubles 4 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

2 September, Tuesday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass Go 1 Time

Dice

Shut Down 1 time

Cash

Collect 3 Stickers

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

3 September, Wednesday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Roll 5 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Upgrade 1 Landmark

Cash

Land on Chance 2 Times

Dice

4 September, Thursday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Roll 5 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Bank heist 1 time

Cash

Upgrade 1 Landmarks

Dice

5 September, Friday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass Go 2 times

Dice

Shut Down 2 times

Cash

Collect 3 Stickers

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

6 September, Saturday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Collect Cash

Dice

Pass GO 2 Times

Cash

Roll Doubles 2 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

7 September, Sunday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass GO 1 Time

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Complete 1 Bank Heist

Cash

Collect 1 Sticker

Dice

You can roll with a higher multiplier to quickly complete your Quick Wins. For instance, if you need to roll the dice five times, using the x5 multiplier can help you complete this task in one go. This applies to all Quick Win tasks, except building and upgrading landmarks.

After completing a task, hit the “Tap to Claim!” button to add points to your progress bar at the bottom of the screen. As you progress through the Quick Wins during the week, you can win several rewards by hitting the milestones marked on the progress bar.

This weekly progress bar resets every Monday , so make sure to complete your Quick Wins every day to fill the bar and claim the grand prize. The daily Quick Wins reset happens at 1 PM UTC , so complete them on time to avoid losing progress.

When a Partners Event, Tycoon Racers, Peg-E Prize Drop, or Treasure Hunt minigame is live, completing Quick Wins also rewards you with the necessary tokens for these events. This is an effective way to get more tokens every day and conquer these exciting minigames.

item.title: Carnival Tycoon Free Batteries & Coins Links (September 2025)
item.description:
Carnival Tycoon is a fun mobile simulation game where players get to design, expand, and manage their very own carnival empire. However, like most free-to-play games, progress can sometimes feel slow without the right resources. Batteries act as your energy source, which lets you keep playing and upgrading, while coins are important for purchasing upgrades. Without enough of these, you might find yourself stuck waiting for timers or grinding for longer than you’d like.

That’s where free Carnival Tycoon links come in. The developers occasionally release special links that reward players with free batteries and coins. By redeeming these links, you can instantly stock up on resources without spending real money or waiting hours for refills.

Carnival Tycoon Links For September 2025

Carnival Tycoon reward links are a great way to get ahead and continue your journey to build a park and becoming a tycoon, especially if you’re in the middle of a big upgrade or simply want to keep playing without interruptions.

Here’s a list of all the working Carnival Tycoon Links for September 2025.

  • 15 batteries and coins
  • 15 batteries and coins
  • 15 batteries and coins

Carnival Tycoon links reset after some time. If you don’t claim them within a certain window, they expire and can’t be redeemed.

How To Redeem Carnival Tycoon Links

Needless to say, Carnival Tycoon Links can only be claimed once per account, so don’t waste time trying to click them repeatedly. Redeeming free batteries and coin links in Carnival Tycoon is quick and simple. Just follow these steps:

  • Click on an active Carnival Tycoon reward link.
  • The link will automatically redirect you to the Carnival Tycoon app on your phone or tablet.
  • Make sure you’re logged in to the game with the account where you want the rewards delivered.
  • Once the game opens, a pop-up should appear confirming that you’ve received batteries, coins, or other freebies.

The best strategy is to claim the rewards as soon as you see them. This way, the rewards will add up, and you’ll never run out of resources. The extra resources can give you the energy to keep playing, help you afford new rides and attractions, and make the game far more enjoyable overall.

Always make sure you’re only using links from trusted sources. Since the game is popular, fake or malicious links sometimes appear online, and clicking them could put your device or personal information at risk.

Carnival Tycoon is available now for Android and iOS.

item.title: Gamer Buys Used Copy of GTA 3 and Finds a Surprise Inside the Case
item.description:
A gamer bought a used copy of Grand Theft Auto 3 for the PS2 and discovered that the previous owner had left behind a hand-written note. The find has generated a lot of nostalgia for GTA 3 fans and gamers who were around during the PS2 era in general.

While it didn't reach the same heights as the subsequent sequels that followed, Grand Theft Auto 3 was a smash hit on the PlayStation 2 at launch. Gamers were let loose in an open world where they could wreak havoc, but it didn't take long for players to realize that the trouble they caused would generally come back to them. From the looks of it, the previous owner of this game was ready for a bit of chaos.

Gamers Buys GTA 3 and Gets a Handwritten List of Codes

On Reddit, user niallniallniall explained that they had purchased a copy of GTA 3 for the PS2, and discovered that it contained a list of cheats the previous owner had used. The list is handwritten, and includes GTA 3 's built-in cheat codes. Specifically, the list includes increasing or decreasing a wanted level, getting all weapons, increasing health to full, and restoring all armor to full.

Fans responding to the post seem to be amused and nostalgic, with the story gaining over 17,000 upvotes at the time of publication. Those in the comments have been sharing stories and amusing memories regarding the game and how gaming worked at the time. One mentioned a strategy of writing down codes from game magazines while their mother shopped, while others rattled off the GTA cheat codes they still have fully memorized all these years after GTA 3 released. Others expressed surprise that the list was missing some cheats they considered invaluable, like spawning the Rhino tank, or the flying car cheat code.

Over the years, used games have become a bit of a time capsule for gamers, with buyers finding things like this cheat list, hand-written notes, and even maps. Depending on the type of game, fans also frequently find players' old saves, with notable discoveries including things like full Pokemon teams and funny letters in Animal Crossing . As the game industry continues to shift towards an all-digital future, treasure troves like this one may become a rarity or even extinct someday. For the present, though, there's no telling what a fan might discover when they buy a used copy of a game.

item.title: Best Co-Op Games Where You Share A Single Screen
item.description:
Summary

  • Co-op games here keep everyone on one screen, promoting teamwork and coordination in a shared space.
  • Laughter, panic, and cooperation ensue as players navigate challenges together within tight, defined spaces.
  • Whether swinging blob-like characters, saving space bunnies, or battling enemies, these games create unique, personal experiences.

Some multiplayer games hand each player a separate screen, camera, or even an entire world to explore on their own. But these titles do the opposite. They force everyone to work in the same frame, navigating chaos, puzzles, or precision under one lens. There’s no room to wander off or zone out; what happens to one player is always in plain view of the other.

And that’s exactly what makes these co-op experiences feel so personal, reactive, and downright memorable. Whether it's two yarn creatures navigating an emotional journey or four flat squares dodging death at absurd speeds, these games prove that shared screens don’t just bring players together, they glue them there.

Heave Ho

The Art Of Falling Together

Heave Ho
Adventure
Systems
Released
March 29, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Le Cartel Studio
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
Powered by

No HUDs, no combat, just a bunch of floppy-armed blobs holding on for dear life. Heave Ho builds its entire identity around players swinging, climbing, and flinging each other across increasingly ludicrous gaps. The only way forward is to physically link arms and pray that the human holding the controller next to you doesn’t forget which button grips.

The shared screen never scrolls out too far, meaning everyone can see exactly how catastrophically wrong a jump is about to go. But that's part of the appeal. There’s something inherently funny about watching four people try to act like a chain of Olympic gymnasts while screeching in panic. No matter how many times someone flings the group into a pit by mistake, it’s never frustrating; it’s slapstick in the best way.

Overcooked! All You Can Eat

The Kitchen Is On Fire, Again

Overcooked! All You Can Eat
Simulation
Systems
Released
November 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Mild Cartoon Violence
Developer(s)
Ghost Town Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

It starts with onions and ends in screaming. Overcooked! All You Can Eat bundles both games and every DLC into a full-course chaos simulator where every player shares a single screen and a kitchen that has no chill. Orders pile up. Counters catch fire. Someone’s been holding a raw fish for 20 seconds too long.

The camera never cuts or zooms out. Instead, players constantly cross each other’s paths in a frenzy of pans, plates, and pure panic. Levels escalate quickly, from food trucks drifting apart to space stations with teleporters, and every inch of screen real estate matters. Success demands synchronized movement and rapid-fire communication, but even failure is fun when the kitchen goes down in flames with everyone still yelling, “Where’s the rice?”

Flat Heroes

What If Super Meat Boy Had Four Best Friends

Flat Heroes
Action
Systems
Released
September 8, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
Powered by

Minimalism doesn’t mean simple, especially not here. Flat Heroes turns four squares into some of the fastest, most precise characters in 2D platforming, and throws them into waves of laser-dodging, wall-jumping, enemy-smashing arenas. The shared screen is baked into the design, and players can’t outrun each other because the game doesn't scroll. Everything happens within tight, defined spaces.

The action is crisp and responsive, with movements so fast they sometimes border on visual noise. But that’s where the shared screen shines. No one gets lost. Everyone’s in the same danger zone, reacting to the same spike bursts and projectile patterns. The result is a rhythm game disguised as a platformer, with players dashing in perfect harmony or dying together in slow-motion glory.

Moving Out 2

The Joy Of Tripping Over A Couch

Moving Out 2
Simulation
Systems
Released
August 15, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Crude Humor
Developer(s)
SMG Studio, Devm Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Switch, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
Powered by

Furniture delivery shouldn’t be this stressful (or this funny). Moving Out 2 refines the madness of the original into a smoother, more absurd package, where players share one screen and one purpose: get everything into the truck before time runs out. The catch? Most objects are too big to carry solo, doors don’t always open, and sometimes portals are involved.

The shared screen enforces constant awareness of each other’s movements. When someone grabs a couch, the other better be on the right side of it or it’s going through a window. And when obstacles like slime floors, treadmill hallways, or haunted pianos show up, coordination goes from optional to essential. It’s goofy, it’s physical, and it absolutely does not care if players are yelling at each other by the end.

Castle Crashers

Swords, Spells, And Sandwiches

Castle Crashers
8 /10
8.8 /10
Released
August 27, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood and Gore, Cartoon Violence, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
The Behemoth
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Long before “couch co-op” was a marketing phrase, Castle Crashers was making living rooms rowdy with up to four players battling their way across absurd medieval battlefields. The shared screen setup is a classic side-scrolling beat ’em up, but the pacing is fast, the enemy variety wild, and the art style instantly recognizable thanks to The Behemoth’s signature flash animation.

There’s magic, animal companions, sandwiches that turn players into hulking giants, and boss fights that feel like mini- Metal Slug encounters. When someone goes down, another player has to revive them, often while dodging arrows and juggling enemies. No one ever drifts offscreen or gets lost. Everyone is in the mess together, and that makes even the dumbest victory dance feel earned.

Lovers In A Dangerous Spacetime

Our Ship, Ourselves

Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime
9.0 /10
Released
February 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

Inside the bubblegum-colored chaos of Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime , two players control a single spaceship by running between its various stations: shields, weapons, navigation, and more. The ship’s interior fits snugly on one screen, making it easy to see what needs doing and who’s lagging.

Each player picks roles on the fly, switching between tasks mid-battle while navigating asteroid fields and saving space bunnies. The charm is in how players compensate for each other’s habits. One might prioritize shields, the other always takes the helm. But when a boss starts spawning missiles from every angle, there’s no time for routine. The shared space demands fast coordination and constant communication, all while looking like a cartoon toy commercial from the 90s.

TowerFall Ascension

Arrows, Platforms, And Accidental Betrayals

TowerFall Ascension
7 /10
9.0 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 84 /100 Critics Rec: 75%
Released
June 25, 2013

Powered by

There’s no time for friendship in TowerFall Ascension , only arrows and perfect timing. This 2D arena battler makes tight maps feel like chessboards, where every jump, dodge, and shot can change the outcome. The camera never zooms out far; players are always visible, always close, and always a threat to each other.

In co-op mode, players team up against waves of enemies, but with limited arrows and friendly fire on, it’s easy to accidentally ruin a run. That’s part of the brilliance. It encourages precise movement, quick thinking, and the occasional apology. What makes it special is how crisp it all feels. Movement is buttery smooth, collisions are clean, and there’s nothing quite like catching someone’s arrow mid-air before launching it back into their face.

Unravel 2

Two Yarnys, One Thread

Unravel 2
Platformer
Systems
Released
June 9, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Coldwood Interactive
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

No UI, no dialogue, no split-screen. Just two yarn creatures tethered together, navigating nature’s quietest threats. Unravel 2 tells its story without a single spoken word, relying on movement, mood, and shared puzzles. It’s not just about getting from A to B; it’s about how players get there together, usually by swinging one another across gaps or acting as an anchor against raging wind or flowing water.

The screen stays zoomed in just enough to keep the focus intimate. Players are never far apart, and the thread between them is both literal and emotional. The game rewards patience, rhythm, and trust. It’s a soft experience that slowly becomes surprisingly intricate, and every leap, climb, or shared success feels like a small, personal victory with someone just inches away.
